LuaScript
Item/Tile Oriented Functions

LuaScriptInterface::registerFunctions()
  |
  +--lua_register(L, "name", C_function);
Sub Catagory Item/Tile Oriented Functions
part of LuaScriptInterface

This sub catagory contains functions which returns data or modifies values from players. When data is returned it comes in either the form of a integer, string, or a position data type. Examples: 

	-- Example 1
	function onUse(cid, item, frompos, item2, topos)
		local player = getThingfromPos(topos)
		if getPlayerAccess(player.uid) == 5 then
			-- script here
		end
		return 1
	end
	
	-- Example 2:
	function onUse(cid, item, frompos, item2, topos)
		if getPlayerTown(cid) == 1 then
			local town = "Viloma city"
			doPlayerSay(cid, 'My town is ' .. town .. '.', 16)
		end
		return 1	
	end

 
Function Parameter Summary
uid
          +--Used when refering to the unique id of a creature. After obtaining a player/creature with a function such as getPlayerByName(name) or getThingfromPos(pos), you can use certain functions on that player/creature by setting the parameter of uid to "yourtempvariable".uid or just "function".uid
cid
          +--Used when refering to the player stated in the primary function. (The one doing that action) You can use certain functions with cid by setting the parameter of uid to cid.
skillid
          +--Used when refering to a specific skills. The value corispondes with the location in the tibia client. -- add the specific skillid's for ref. --
itemid
          +--Used when refering to a specific item type. The value corispondes with the id of the item to be added/deleted.
slot
          +--Used when refering to a specific slot in your character.(backpack slot, sword slot, ect.) -- add the specific slot id's for ref. --
depotid
          +--Used when refering to a specific depot. The value corrispondes with the value of the depot box modified in the map editor.
name
          +--Used when refering to a specific player's name or a certain spell's name.
food
          +--Used when refering to the amount of hunger to be taken away from a player.
text
          +--Used when refering to a string representation of words that are going to be said
 

Function Detail

food

getPlayerFood(uid)
This function returns the food ('hunger') value of the player. Usage : Used mostly when making scripts that deal with eating.

vocation

getPlayerVocation(uid)
This function returns the vocation type of the player. The returned value is a integer. Usage : Used mostly when restricting a action to a certain vocation type.
